required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of KAI-4169 in Healthy Male Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Rising Single Intravenous Dose Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of KAI-4169 in Healthy Male Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to characterize the safety and tolerability of KAI-4169 in healthy young males.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of rising single doses of KAI-4169 by IV injection in healthy male subjects

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamics of rising single doses of KAI-4169 by IV injection in healthy male subjects
Pharmacokinetics of rising single doses of KAI-4169 by IV injection in healthy male subjects

arm_group.description: Subjects will be randomly assigned to KAI-4169 or Placebo
Subjects will be randomly assigned to KAI-4169 or Placebo

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male between 18 and 45 years of age who have provided written informed consent
- Subject is judged to be in good health based on medical history, physical examination, and routine laboratory tests
Exclusion Criteria:
- History or presence of any significant acute or chronic illness (e.g., cardiovascular, pulmonary, hepatic, renal, hematologic, gastrointestinal, endocrine, immunologic, dermatologic, or neurologic disease) according to the investigator
- History of any ongoing medical condition requiring treatment with prescription medication
- History of asthma, severe allergies including skin reactions or prior anaphylactic type reactions
- Clinically significant abnormalities on screening clinical examination or laboratory safety tests
- History of drug or alcohol abuse

responsible_party.name_title: Karen Pickthorn, Senior Director Clinical Development
